answerText: Leon Brillouin[10] This type of Brillouin scattering occurs in nonlinear media; the word describing this type of scattering also describes a type of quantum emission whose probability is controlled by the Einstein B coefficients.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Lawrence U and Georgia Tech | 6 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This man gave the definitive explanation of Maxwell's demon in terms of informational entropy. For ten points each:  [10] Identify this French physicist, whose name is given to the frequency-domain image of the primitive cell in band-gap theory.
